verses.kjv: Then said the LORD unto me, Go yet, love a woman beloved of her friend, yet an adulteress, according to the love of the LORD toward the children of Israel, who look to other gods, and love flagons of wine.
verses.ct: Then the LORD told me, "Go again and love a woman who is loved by another man and is an adulteress. Love her the same way the LORD loves the people of Israel, even though they turn to other gods and are devoted to raisin cakes."

verses.kjv: So I bought her to me for fifteen pieces of silver, and for an homer of barley, and an half homer of barley:
verses.ct: So I purchased her for 15 pieces of silver and about 10 bushels of barley.

verses.kjv: And I said unto her, Thou shalt abide for me many days; thou shalt not play the harlot, and thou shalt not be for another man: so will I also be for thee.
verses.ct: Then I told her, "You must stay with me for a long time. You must not prostitute yourself, and you must not be with another man. I will do the same for you."

verses.kjv: For the children of Israel shall abide many days without a king, and without a prince, and without a sacrifice, and without an image, and without an ephod, and without teraphim:
verses.ct: Because the people of Israel will go a long time without a king, without a leader, without sacrifices, without sacred pillars, without a priestly vest, and without household idols.

verses.kjv: Afterward shall the children of Israel return, and seek the LORD their God, and David their king; and shall fear the LORD and his goodness in the latter days.
verses.ct: After that, the people of Israel will come back and search for the LORD their God and for David their king. They will come with deep reverence to the LORD and to his goodness in the final days.
